newsitem.title: GERMANY: VW wows German stock market with 97 outlook.
newsitem.headline: VW wows German stock market with 97 outlook.

text.p: The stock of Europe's largest carmaker Volkswagen soared to record highs Friday on an extremely upbeat outlook for 1997 and a series of analysts' upgrades.
VW shares hit an all-time high of 1,117.50 German marks ($649), a rise of over 12 percent, in bourse trade in Frankfurt and analysts said they could head as high as 1,500 marks ($872), this year.

The stock lipped from the highs later in the day as profit-taking kicked in, but still ended with marked gains. VW closed the bourse session at 1,072.50 marks ($624), up 76.50 marks ($44.5), or 7.68 percent, before easing to 1,049 marks ($610) in post-bourse dealings.

The stock's dramatic rise began Thursday, when Volkswagen kicked off 1997 by forecasting better first quarter earnings due to a 9.5 percent rise in sales and said it expected higher profits and turnover for the year.
Shares penetrated the 1,000 mark level for the first time shortly after the results were announced. They continued to strengthen after analysts met Volkswagen and emerged bullish.
A rash of earnings upgrades followed, as well as hikes in share price targets for the year, and Volkswagen advanced strongly early on Friday.
